Package src.model

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Strategy
    Strategy class to implement different strategies
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Aggressive
    Aggressive: Computer player strategy that focuses on attack (reinforces its strongest country, then always attack with it until it cannot attack anymore, then fortifies in order to maximize aggregation of forces in one country).
    Benevolent
    Benevolent: computer player strategy that focuses on protecting its weak countries (reinforces its weakest countries, never attacks, then fortifies in order to move armies to weaker countries).
    Card
    This class is used to create cards according to the Risk rules.
    Cheater
    Cheater: computer player strategy whose reinforce() method doubles the number of armies on all its countries, whose attack() method automatically conquers all the neighbors of all its countries, and whose fortify() method doubles the number of armies on its countries that have neighbors that belong to other players.
    Continent  
    GameConfig  
    GenericFunctions
    This class contains generic functions and common constants that are used across the whlole application.
    Human
    Human: Player that requires user interaction to make decisions.
    MapEditor
    This class is used to instantiate the map editor, to enable the user to add or delete the country, continent.
    Maps
    This class is used to instantiate maps, which reads the map files into memory.
    Player
    This class is used to instantiate players, and different attributes.
    Random
    Random player: A random computer player strategy that reinforces random a random country, attacks a random number of times a random country, and fortifies a random country, all following the standard rules for each phase.
    Territory
    This class is used to instantiate different territories along with information such as stationed armies and adjecent countries to each country.
